workflow.name: Filter cybersecurity news for your tech stack (OpenAI + Pinecone RAG)
workflow.description:
## What it does:
Collects cybersecurity news from trusted RSS feeds and uses OpenAI‚Äôs Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) capabilities with Pinecone to filter for content that is directly relevant to your organization‚Äôs tech stack. ‚ÄúRelevant‚Äù means the AI looks for news items that mention your specific tools, vendors, frameworks, cloud platforms, programming languages, operating systems, or security solutions ‚Äî as described in your .txt scope documents. By training on these documents, the system understands the environment you operate in and can prioritize news that could affect your security posture, compliance, or operational stability. Once filtered, summaries of the most important items are sent to your work email every day.

## How it works
- **Pulls in news from multiple cybersecurity-focused RSS feeds:** The workflow automatically collects articles from trusted, high-signal security news sources. These feeds cover threat intelligence, vulnerability disclosures, vendor advisories, and industry updates.
- **Filters articles for recency and direct connection to your documented tech stack:** Using the publish date, it removes stale or outdated content. Then, leveraging your .txt scope documents stored in Pinecone, it checks each article for references to your technologies, vendors, platforms, or security tools.
- **Uses OpenAI to generate and review concise summaries:** For each relevant article, OpenAI creates a short, clear summary of the key points. The AI also evaluates whether the article provides actionable or critical information before passing it through.
- **Trains on your scope using Pinecone Vector Store (free) for context-aware filtering:** Your scope documents are embedded into a vector store so the AI can ‚Äúremember‚Äù your environment. This context ensures the filtering process understands indirect or non-obvious connections to your tech stack.
- **Aggregates and sends only the most critical items to your work email:** The system compiles the highest-priority news items into one daily digest, so you can review key developments without wading through irrelevant stories.

## What you need to do:
1. Setup your OpenAI and Pinecone credentials in the workflow
2. Create and configure a Pinecone index (dimension 1536 recommended)
	1. Pinecone is free to setup.
	2. Setup Pinecone with a single free index.
	3. Use a namespace like: scope.
	4. Make sure the embedding model is the same for all of your Pinecone references.
3. Submit .txt scope documents listing your technologies, vendors, platforms, frameworks, and security products.
	1. .txt does not need to be structured.
	2. Add as much detail as possible.
4. Update AI prompts to accurately describe your company‚Äôs environment and priorities.

parameters.text:
=You are a cybersecurity threat intelligence analyst. Your goal is to sort through cybersecurity news. Since we are a small team, only include news that includes specific vulnerabilities or is extremely relevant and requires our action. My firm uses these systems: - List out here - List as many as you can think of - This is where you list Title of article: {{ $json.title }} Review this content: {{ $json.content }} Here is the link: {{ $json.link }} Use the Pinecone Vector Store tool as it has context on if the article content is relevant. This will help you find context for what is in scope (relevant) and what is out of scope. If you think I should read this, please summarize the content and include the link. If not applicable, return one word: N/A - without any additional info. In general I am busy so I don't want to read often. If it does not seem actionable or highly relevant, return one word: N/A Format the output in HTML with a header and body. No need to define as HTML document because it will be embeded in an email. Header should be a five words describing the article. Format should be:

Five Word Title Goes Here

Summary: Then explain the article's summary.

Read the full article

parameters.toolDescription: Retrieve data from your vector store Pinecone

parameters.content:
## Test RAG
Use this chatbot to test if RAG is working and has the correct data.

## Document submission for RAG
This workflow is how you upload .txt files to RAG for ingestion.

parameters.text:
=You are a cybersecurity executive advisor responsible for vetting the output of a threat intelligence analyst. The analyst's job is to scan cybersecurity news and produce executive summaries of articles that may impact my company. You are the second layer of review before anything gets sent to the Analyst.

Your job is to decide if the summary is strong enough to be worth forwarding. Only approve it if it is highly actionable, time-sensitive, preventative measures or involves software/platforms used by our company. Your pass rate for an article should hover around 75%.

Decision Options:
If the article should be forwarded, improve the HTML formatting slightly if needed.
If the article should NOT be sent, return this exact response:N/A

Evaluation Criteria:
The article involves a vulnerability, exploit, or incident impacting the listed platforms
It describes a current threat actor campaign or tactic we are likely to encounter
It includes a CVE with confirmed exploitation or ties to CISA KEV
It describes vendor patching guidance or mitigation steps relevant to our stack
Anything else is not worth passing along

Tone:
Be brief and clinical
No speculation
No flattery
Prioritize reducing cognitive load for busy executives

AI Agent output for review:
{{ $json.output }}

parameters.content:
## RSS feeds
Pulls RSS feeds from main cybersecurity news sites.

## Limit length of article
Some articles are really long. Limits length while still keeping enough for AI to understand

parameters.toolDescription: Pull data from here to have context on what articles are relative based on feedback stored in the vector store.

nodes.name: If AI Agent thinks article is relevant to you
If second ai agent thinks article is relevant
Do nothing - Ai Agent thinks article is irrelevant

parameters.content:
## AI Agent 1 = Pinecone Scope Reviewer
This AI Agent reviews the Pinecone Vector Store and determines if the articles match the scope of what you have defined in the .txt documents you have added to Pinecone.

## AI Agent 2 = Review again
This AI Agent's job is to decide if the summary is strong enough to be worth forwarding. It only approves it if it is highly actionable, time-sensitive, preventative measures or involves software/platforms used by your company.

main.node: If AI Agent thinks article is relevant to you
If second ai agent thinks article is relevant
Do nothing - Ai Agent thinks article is irrelevant

user.name: Will Carlson
user.bio: IT Security and Compliance professional with a deep passion for AI and AI Orchestration.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
